headline.main: World Briefing | Asia: Philippines: Fighting Continues

lead_paragraph: Six Muslim rebels were killed in clashes near the southern city of Zamboanga, and the military said it would file charges against scores of others who had mounted a revolt. The fighting occurred a day after most of the rebels agreed to swap 113 civilian hostages for safe passage outside the city, ending two days of fighting that had claimed 28 lives. Lt. Gen. Roy Cimatu said charges would be filed against all the rebels, including those given safe passage.
abstract: Six Muslim rebels are killed ir
